Name: Tale of Tales
Review: Beautifully filmed, follows three fairy tales, dark and a bit gross. Really loved the set design, rich details, set location!!

Name: Damsel
Review: Inspirational, great mountain shots, main actress is beautiful and believable

Name: Lost and Found
Review: Filmed in Hong Kong and Scotland in peak 90's fashion. HK vibes haven't changed in 30 years. A film about facing the end of life and hope. Romantic.

Name: The Wedding Banquet
Review:
directed by Ang Lee, shot entirely in NYC. Helped me to relive the 90's chinese wedding banquet memories, IMO very accurate vibes down to the wedding games they played. 

I appreciate the relatable story line but this movie just didn't capture my love. The characters felt flat and forced - they didn't have "rizz" despite how beautiful Wei Wei is. 

Overall, great piece into the dynamics of homosexuality, family tradition, and the chinese wedding banquets in NYC of the 90s

Name: In Time
Review: Premise was good but too many plotholes. Way too easy to steal "time" from other people. Actors flat.

Name: Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse
The Substance
Review: Infuriating to watch as the characters continue to make bad decisions for seemingly no reason. A truly hard-to-watch body horror film.

Name: The Ugly Stepsister
Review: immersive well done body horror with a lot of social commentary on body dysmorphia, value and acceptance.

Name: The Lure
Review: If the little mermaid had a sister and sang in Polish with groove and punk rock in 80s aesthetic, this is the dark fantasy film for you. Strong vibes and lore, a little slow at times.

Name: Casino
Review:
Really awesome Scorsese film based in Las Vegas. Reminds me of Goodfellas but the difference is that in addition to great story telling, i can see the characters really rise and fall. And that's because Casino is based off the life of a real person: Frank "Lefty" Rosenthal. Check his wikipedia. I enjoyed the hostility of Joe Pesci as Nicky, Robert De Niros intensity as Sam Rothstein. And Sharon Stones frustration and spiral as her character, Ginger. 
Aesthetics are incredible, set in the shining 70s glitz and glamour of Vegas as an organized crime paradise.

Name: Eternity
Review: Wholesome, cute premise, elizabeth olsen is beautiful to look at. similar to "upload".

Name: Like Water for Chocolate
Review: An understated fairy tale that's full of texture and mood. Immediately takes audience into a otherworldly cowboy ranches of victorian era Mexico. The film marries food with emotions. Features beautiful, eloquent, clearly spoken Spanish (great for anyone spanish learners!)

Name: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
Review:
Opa! Super cute rom com. Can't believe it took me so many years to get to it. I love that the film highlights the zest and spice of coming from an immigrant family living in America. But despite the cultural differences, family is family. And family comes with rooted traditions and deep obligations -- which can weigh down freedom and personal desires. 

Both sides of the family place themselves into uncomfortable situations. And that's what this is about -- embracing discomfort with bravery and acceptance. 

And I loved how Nia Vardalos, who plays the lead Toula, was cast as an untraditional beauty. Framed as a frumpy, pitiful spinster in the beginning, she pulls herself into better circumstances thru her own ambitions before finding her love. 

Also, gotta try the windex trick :)
Tags: family friendly, culture, greek culture, family values

Name: Meet Joe Black
Review:
Brad Pitt plays Death as a peanut-butter loving autistic boy and Susan somehow find this mysterious and attractive *cue eye roll* 

They were clearly trying to ride Pitts success in Interview with a Vampire. But the storyline was flat and forced, acting was wooden, and nobody had any chemistry. 

I would only watch this movie for the visuals - nothing else. Great cast, gorgeous set and location, every visual detail was elegant and timeless (the ethereal pool room was straight out of a greek tragedy) 

The whole film felt like a joke that took too long to get to the punchline "death and taxes"

Name: Gattaca
Review: The kind of film that stays with you long after it's over

Name: Run
Review: The final scene was an ode to Gypsy Rose Blanchard. Clocked it right away.

Name: Weird Science
Review: These kids casually invented AGI in 1985. And she's magic.
